intro: Mirandaceltis monoica, commonly known as the Mirandaceltis tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
